intro: Uncinia smithii, commonly known as the hooked beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clustered, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, such as slopes and gravelly soils. Its flowers are usually pink to purple and bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Uncinia smithii is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it thrives in cooler, moist environments.
